column3: Truth, like gold, is to be obtained not by its growth, but by washing away from it all that is not gold.
Be truthful, nature only sides with truth.

Remember the sufferings of Christ, the storms that were weathered... the crown that came from those sufferings which gave new radiance to the faith... All saints give testimony to the truth that without real effort, no one ever wins the crown.
It is a melancholy truth that even great men have their poor relations.
The science of operations, as derived from mathematics more especially, is a science of itself, and has its own abstract truth and value.

I'm human, I feel, I understand. That's the highest level of love, is understanding - when you can understand someone, when you can love them with their flaws and their faults. So I understand, I consider. I may speak the truth, but I'll consider your feelings, too.
It is the nature of truth in general, as of some ores in particular, to be richest when most superficial.
When in doubt tell the truth.
It's no wonder that truth is stranger than fiction. Fiction has to make sense.
Peace if possible, truth at all costs.
Truth is strong, and sometime or other will prevail.
Man is least himself when he talks in his own person. Give him a mask, and he will tell you the truth.
Whatever satisfies the soul is truth.
The truth. It is a beautiful and terrible thing, and must therefore be treated with great caution.
Whatever has happened in my quest for innovation has been part of my quest for immaculate reality.
Getting rid of a delusion makes us wiser than getting hold of a truth.
The truth is that contraception saves lives, prevents unplanned pregnancies, improves outcomes for children and reduces the number of abortions.
When you have eliminated the impossible, whatever remains, however improbable, must be the truth.
She gave up beauty in her tender youth, gave all her hope and joy and pleasant ways; she covered up her eyes lest they should gaze on vanity, and chose the bitter truth.
Chase after the truth like all hell and you'll free yourself, even though you never touch its coat tails.
There is nothing so strong or safe in an emergency of life as the simple truth.
There is no truth. There is only perception.

Be Impeccable With Your Word. Speak with integrity. Say only what you mean. Avoid using the word to speak against yourself or to gossip about others. Use the power of your word in the direction of truth and love.
No truth is more evident to my mind than that the Christian religion must be the basis of any government intended to secure the rights and privileges of a free people.

The essence of humanity's spiritual dilemma is that we evolved genetically to accept one truth and discovered another. Is there a way to erase the dilemma, to resolve the contradictions between the transcendentalist and the empiricist world views?
I have been given the authority over you, and I am not the best of you. If I do well, help me; and if I do wrong, set me right. Sincere regard for truth.
